titlestmt.titleproper: Numismatic and Antiquarian Society of Philadelphia records 1858-1971
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Numismatic and Antiquarian Society of Philadelphia records
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Formed in 1857, the Numismatic and Antiquarian Society of Philadelphia was a nonprofit organization "dedicated to the encouragement and promotion of numismatic science and antiquarian research." Meetings were often held in the homes of members, where coins and medals were displayed and papers on a variety of subjects were read.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes member lists, invitations, typescripts, published proceedings, accession catalogs for the society's library, correspondence and meeting minutes, some of which include transcripts of talks given at the meetings. The correspondence in the collection is from members, vendors, scholars, and members of the general public seeking expert numismatic advice. The collection also includes clippings, photographs, scrapbooks, a receipt book, etched printing blocks,and a glass negative. The materials cover the period from the society's founding and extend to the late 1960s.

controlaccess.corpname: Numismatic and Antiquarian Society of Philadelphia.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
